page.title: 15The Town Hall
page.content: The town hall was built in 1794 to replace the parvise above the south porch of St Leonards Church for the Council to meet at. In the Council Chamber at the top it is covered with oak panelling which was donated by {William Cobay}who was the Mayor during the first world war. On it were carved all the names of bailiffs from 1349 and all the mayor's names from 1575. The Cinque Port's crest is three lion heads and the sterns of three ships. On the east wall is a moot horn which was presented in 1582 by{Thomas Torney a member of the Torney family who were 19 times mayor. Hythe is twinned with Berck_sur_mur in France and Poperinge in Belgium. On the east wall outside the town hall is a plaque which says 'Unite in their Endeavours to keep this place clean and to prevent boys and others from
